parameters.name: Help
parameters.label: üîé Getting Started

parameters.name: DefaultSubscription_Internal
parameters.query:
where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| take 1
| project subscriptionId

parameters.name: Subscription
parameters.query:
summarize by subscriptionId
| project value = strcat("/subscriptions/", subscriptionId), label = subscriptionId, selected = iff(subscriptionId =~ '{DefaultSubscription_Internal}', true, false)

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces'
| order by name asc
| summarize Selected = makelist(id, 10), All = makelist(id, 1000)
| mvexpand All limit 100
| project value = tostring(All), label = tostring(All), selected = iff(Selected contains All, true, false)

content.json:
## Getting Started This solution is designed to augment staffing through automation, machine learning, query/alerting generation, and visualizations. This workbook leverages Azure Policy, Azure Resource Graph, and Azure Log Analytics to align with NIST SP 800-53 control requirements. A filter set is available for custom reporting by guides, subscriptions, workspaces, time-filtering, control family, and controls. This offering telemetry from 25+ Microsoft Security products, while only Microsoft Sentinel/Microsoft Defender for Cloud are required to get started, each offering provides additional enrichment for aligning with control requirements. Each NIST SP 800-53 control includes a Control Card detailing an overview of requirements, primary/secondary controls, deep-links to referenced product pages/portals, recommendations, implementation guides, compliance cross-walks and tooling telemetry for building situational awareness of cloud workloads. ### [Recommended Microsoft Sentinel Roles](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/roles) / [Recommended Microsoft Defender for Cloud Roles](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/permissions#roles-and-allowed-actions) | Roles | Rights | |:--|:--| |Security Reader | View Workbooks, Analytics, Hunting, Security Recommendations | |Security Contributor| Deploy/Modify Workbooks, Analytics, Hunting Queries, Apply Security Recommendations | |Automation Contributor| Deploy/Modify Playbooks & Automation Rules | |Owner| Assign Regulatory Compliance Initiatives| ### Onboarding Prerequisites 1Ô∏è‚É£ [Access Microsoft 365 Compliance Manager: Assessments](https://compliance.microsoft.com/compliancemanager?viewid=Assessments)
2Ô∏è‚É£ [Onboard Microsoft Sentinel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/quickstart-onboard)
3Ô∏è‚É£ [Onboard Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/security-center/security-center-get-started)
4Ô∏è‚É£ [Add the Microsoft Defender for Cloud: NIST SP 800-53 R4 & R5 Assessments to Your Dashboard](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/security-center/update-regulatory-compliance-packages#add-a-regulatory-standard-to-your-dashboard)
5Ô∏è‚É£ [Continuously Export Security Center Data to Log Analytics Workspace](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/security-center/continuous-export)
6Ô∏è‚É£ [Extend Microsoft Sentinel Across Workspaces and Tenants](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/extend-sentinel-across-workspaces-tenants)
7Ô∏è‚É£ [Configure Auto Provisioning of Microsoft Defender for Cloud Agents](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/enable-data-collection)
8Ô∏è‚É£ [Review Microsoft Service Trust Portal Documentation/Audit/Resources](https://servicetrust.microsoft.com/)
### Print/Export Report 1Ô∏è‚É£ Set Background Theme: Settings > Appearance > Theme: Azure > Apply
2Ô∏è‚É£ Print/Export Report: More Content Actions (...) > Print Content
3Ô∏è‚É£ Settings: Layout (Landscape), Pages (All), Print (One Sided), Scale (60), Pages Per Sheet (1), Quality (1,200 DPI), Margins (None) > Print
4Ô∏è‚É£ Executive Summary: Microsoft Defender for Cloud > Regulatory Compliance > Download Report > Report Standard (NIST SP 800 53 R4), Format (PDF) ### Important Each control below is associated with one or more üí°[Azure Policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/overview) definitions. These policies may help you üí°[Assess Compliance](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/how-to/get-compliance-data) with the control; however, there often is not a one-to-one or complete match between a control and one or more policies. As such, Compliant in Azure Policy refers only to the policy definitions themselves; this doesn't ensure you're fully compliant with all requirements of a control. In addition, the compliance standard includes controls that aren't addressed by any Azure Policy definitions at this time. Therefore, compliance in Azure Policy is only a partial view of your overall compliance status. The associations between compliance domains, controls, and Azure Policy definitions for this compliance standard may change over time. To view the change history, see the üí°[GitHub Commit History](https://github.com/Azure/azure-policy/commits/master/built-in-policies/policySetDefinitions/Regulatory%20Compliance/NIST80053_audit.json). For more information, see üí°[Details of the NIST SP 800-53 Regulatory Compliance built-in initiative](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4) Customer experience will vary by user and some panels may require additional configurations for operation. Recommendations do not imply coverage of respective controls as they are often one of several courses of action for approaching requirements which is unique to each customer. Recommendations should be considered a starting point for planning full or partial coverage of respective requirements. This workbook does not address all controls within the framework. It should be considered a supplemental tool to gain visibility of technical controls within cloud, multi-cloud, and hybrid networks. For the full listing of respective controls, see theüí°[Microsoft Cloud Service Trust Portal](https://servicetrust.microsoft.com/)

# [NIST SP 800-53 Solution](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4)
---

This Solution enables Compliance Teams, Architects, SecOps Analysts, and Consultants to gain situational awareness for cloud workload security posture. This Solution is designed to augment staffing through automation, visibility, assessment, monitoring and remediation. The Microsoft Sentinel: NIST SP 800-53 Solution demonstrates best practice guidance, but Microsoft does not guarantee nor imply compliance. All requirements, validations, and controls are governed by the üí°[National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)](https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/detail/sp/800-53/rev-5/final)

# [Executive Summary](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/regulatory-compliance-dashboard)
---

This section leverages Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance for policy assessments. Find, fix, and resolve recommendations aligned to the NIST SP 800-53 Regulatory Compliance Initiative. A selector provides capability to filter by all, specific, or groups of controls by level. Upon selection, subordinate panels will summarize recommendations by control family, status over time, recommendations, and resources identified.

parameters.name: ComplianceDomain
parameters.label: Control Family
parameters.query:
SecurityRegulatoryCompliance
| where ComplianceStandard == "NIST-SP-800-53-R4"
| extend ComplianceDomain=iff(ComplianceControl contains "AC.", "Access Control", iff(ComplianceControl contains "AT.", "Security Awareness & Training", iff(ComplianceControl contains "AU.", "Audit & Accountability", iff(ComplianceControl contains "CA.", "Security Assessment", iff(ComplianceControl contains "CM.", "Configuration Management", iff(ComplianceControl contains "CP.", "Contingency Planning", iff(ComplianceControl contains "IA.", "Identification & Authentication", iff(ComplianceControl contains "IR.", "Incident Response", iff(ComplianceControl contains "MA.", "System Maintenance", iff(ComplianceControl contains "MP.", "Media Protection", iff(ComplianceControl contains "PE.", "Physical Protection", iff(ComplianceControl contains "PL.", "Security Planning", iff(ComplianceControl contains "PS.", "Personnel Security",iff(ComplianceControl contains "RA.", "Risk Assessment",iff(ComplianceControl contains "SA.", "System & Services Acquisition",iff(ComplianceControl contains "SC.", "System & Communications Protection",iff(ComplianceControl contains "SI.", "System & Information Integrity","Other")))))))))))))))))
| summarize count() by ComplianceDomain
| sort by count_ desc
| project-away count_

content.query:
securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | join kind = leftouter(
    securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/assessments") on subscriptionId, name
    | extend complianceState = properties.state
    | extend resourceSource = tolower(tostring(properties1.resourceDetails.Source))
    | extend recommendationId = id1
    | extend resourceId = trim(' ', tolower(tostring(case(resourceSource =~ 'azure', properties1.resourceDetails.Id,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'gcp', properties1.resourceDetails.GcpResourceId,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'aws', properties1.resourceDetails.AwsResourceId,
                                                        extract('^(.+)/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/.+$',1,recommendationId)))))
    | extend regexResourceId = extract_all(@"/providers/[^/]+(?:/([^/]+)/[^/]+(?:/[^/]+/[^/]+)?)?/([^/]+)/([^/]+)$", resourceId)[0]
    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name
    | extend RecommendationName = properties1.displayName
    | extend description = properties1.metadata.description
    | extend remediationSteps = properties1.metadata.remediationDescription
    | extend severity = properties1.metadata.severity
    | extend state = properties1.status.code
    | extend notApplicableReason = properties1.status.cause
    | extend RecommendationLink = properties1.links.azurePortal
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | extend complianceControlId = extract(@"/regulatoryComplianceControls/([^/]*)", 1, id)
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
| join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink) on RecommendationName
    | extend ComplianceDomain=iff(controlId contains "AC.", "Access Control", iff(controlId contains "AT.", "Security Awareness & Training", iff(controlId contains "AU.", "Audit & Accountability", iff(controlId contains "CA.", "Security Assessment", iff(controlId contains "CM.", "Configuration Management", iff(controlId contains "CP.", "Contingency Planning", iff(controlId contains "IA.", "Identification & Authentication", iff(controlId contains "IR.", "Incident Response", iff(controlId contains "MA.", "System Maintenance", iff(controlId contains "MP.", "Media Protection", iff(controlId contains "PE.", "Physical Protection", iff(controlId contains "PL.", "Security Planning", iff(controlId contains "PS.", "Personnel Security",iff(controlId contains "RA.", "Risk Assessment",iff(controlId contains "SA.", "System & Services Acquisition",iff(controlId contains "SC.", "System & Communications Protection",iff(controlId contains "SI.", "System & Information Integrity","Other")))))))))))))))))
| where ComplianceDomain in ({ComplianceDomain}) 
  | distinct RecommendationName, ComplianceDomain, tostring(RecommendationLink), tostring(state), tostring(complianceState)
  | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy" or complianceState‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Passed"),‚ÄØNotApplicable‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ== "NotApplicable"), Applicable‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy" or complianceState‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Passed"),Total‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy" or complianceState‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Passed" or state‚ÄØ== "NotApplicable") by ComplianceDomain
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Applicable))*100
    | project ControlFamily=ComplianceDomain, Total, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, Applicable, NotApplicable
    | sort by Total, Passed desc
content.title: Recommendations by Control Family

    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name

    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources

    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))

    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy" or complianceState‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Passed"),‚ÄØNotApplicable‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ== "NotApplicable"), Applicable‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy" or complianceState‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Passed"),Total‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy" or complianceState‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Passed" or state‚ÄØ== "NotApplicable") by RecommendationName, ControlID = controlId
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Applicable))*100
| join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink, name) on RecommendationName
    | extend ComplianceDomain=iff(ControlID contains "AC.", "Access Control", iff(ControlID contains "AT.", "Security Awareness & Training", iff(ControlID contains "AU.", "Audit & Accountability", iff(ControlID contains "CA.", "Security Assessment", iff(ControlID contains "CM.", "Configuration Management", iff(ControlID contains "CP.", "Contingency Planning", iff(ControlID contains "IA.", "Identification & Authentication", iff(ControlID contains "IR.", "Incident Response", iff(ControlID contains "MA.", "System Maintenance", iff(ControlID contains "MP.", "Media Protection", iff(ControlID contains "PE.", "Physical Protection", iff(ControlID contains "PL.", "Security Planning", iff(ControlID contains "PS.", "Personnel Security",iff(ControlID contains "RA.", "Risk Assessment",iff(ControlID contains "SA.", "System & Services Acquisition",iff(ControlID contains "SC.", "System & Communications Protection",iff(ControlID contains "SI.", "System & Information Integrity","Other")))))))))))))))))
| where ComplianceDomain in ({ComplianceDomain}) 
    | distinct RecommendationName, Total, RecommendationLink, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, NotApplicable, Applicable, name
    | sort by Total, Passed desc
    | limit 250

content.query:
SecurityRegulatoryCompliance
| where ComplianceStandard == "NIST-SP-800-53-R4"
| extend ComplianceDomain=iff(ComplianceControl contains "AC.", "Access Control", iff(ComplianceControl contains "AT.", "Security Awareness & Training", iff(ComplianceControl contains "AU.", "Audit & Accountability", iff(ComplianceControl contains "CA.", "Security Assessment", iff(ComplianceControl contains "CM.", "Configuration Management", iff(ComplianceControl contains "CP.", "Contingency Planning", iff(ComplianceControl contains "IA.", "Identification & Authentication", iff(ComplianceControl contains "IR.", "Incident Response", iff(ComplianceControl contains "MA.", "System Maintenance", iff(ComplianceControl contains "MP.", "Media Protection", iff(ComplianceControl contains "PE.", "Physical Protection", iff(ComplianceControl contains "PL.", "Security Planning", iff(ComplianceControl contains "PS.", "Personnel Security",iff(ComplianceControl contains "RA.", "Risk Assessment",iff(ComplianceControl contains "SA.", "System & Services Acquisition",iff(ComplianceControl contains "SC.", "System & Communications Protection",iff(ComplianceControl contains "SI.", "System & Information Integrity","Other")))))))))))))))))
| where ComplianceDomain in ({ComplianceDomain})
| where State == "Failed"
| make-series count() default=0 on TimeGenerated from startofday({TimeRange:start}) to startofday({TimeRange:end}) step 1d by ComplianceDomain
| render timechart

content.query:
securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend failedResources = toint(properties.failedResources), passedResources = toint(properties.passedResources),skippedResources = toint(properties.skippedResources)
    | where failedResources + passedResources + skippedResources > 0
    | join kind = leftouter(
    securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/assessments") on subscriptionId, name
    | extend complianceState = properties.state
    | extend resourceSource = tolower(tostring(properties1.resourceDetails.Source))
    | extend recommendationId = id1
    | extend resourceId = trim(' ', tolower(tostring(case(resourceSource =~ 'azure', properties1.resourceDetails.Id,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'gcp', properties1.resourceDetails.GcpResourceId,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'aws', properties1.resourceDetails.AwsResourceId,
                                                        extract('^(.+)/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/.+$',1,recommendationId)))))
    | extend regexResourceId = extract_all(@"/providers/[^/]+(?:/([^/]+)/[^/]+(?:/[^/]+/[^/]+)?)?/([^/]+)/([^/]+)$", resourceId)[0]
    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name
    | extend RecommendationDisplayName = properties1.displayName
    | extend description = properties1.metadata.description
    | extend remediationSteps = properties1.metadata.remediationDescription
    | extend severity = properties1.metadata.severity
    | extend state = properties1.status.code
    | extend notApplicableReason = properties1.status.cause
    | extend azurePortalRecommendationLink = properties1.links.azurePortal
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | extend complianceControlId = extract(@"/regulatoryComplianceControls/([^/]*)", 1, id)
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
    | where state == "Unhealthy"
    | extend Recommendation = strcat("https://",azurePortalRecommendationLink), ResourceID = resourceId, ResourceType = resourceType, ResourceGroup = resourceGroup1, Severity = severity, State = state, ControlID = controlId
    | extend ComplianceDomain=iff(ControlID contains "AC.", "Access Control", iff(ControlID contains "AT.", "Security Awareness & Training", iff(ControlID contains "AU.", "Audit & Accountability", iff(ControlID contains "CA.", "Security Assessment", iff(ControlID contains "CM.", "Configuration Management", iff(ControlID contains "CP.", "Contingency Planning", iff(ControlID contains "IA.", "Identification & Authentication", iff(ControlID contains "IR.", "Incident Response", iff(ControlID contains "MA.", "System Maintenance", iff(ControlID contains "MP.", "Media Protection", iff(ControlID contains "PE.", "Physical Protection", iff(ControlID contains "PL.", "Security Planning", iff(ControlID contains "PS.", "Personnel Security",iff(ControlID contains "RA.", "Risk Assessment",iff(ControlID contains "SA.", "System & Services Acquisition",iff(ControlID contains "SC.", "System & Communications Protection",iff(ControlID contains "SI.", "System & Information Integrity","Other")))))))))))))))))
    | extend FirstObserved = properties1.status.statusChangeDate
    | where ComplianceDomain in ({ComplianceDomain})
    | project ResourceID, RecommendationName=RecommendationDisplayName, ControlFamily=ComplianceDomain, ControlID, Severity=tostring(Severity), CurrentState=State, RecommendationLink=Recommendation, name, FirstObserved
| extend Rank=iff(Severity == "High", 3, iff(Severity == "Medium", 2, iff(Severity == "Low", 1, 0)))
| sort by Rank desc
| limit 2500
content.title: Current Recommendation Details
content.noDataMessage: Select Getting Started in Top Left of Workbook. Follow Guidance for Steps 3-5

content.json:
# [Azure Lighthouse](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/azure-lighthouse/)
---
Azure Lighthouse helps service providers simplify customer engagement and onboarding experiences, while managing delegated resources at scale with agility and precision. Authorized users, groups, and service principals can work directly in the context of a customer subscription without having an account in that customer's Microsoft Entra ID tenant or being a co-owner of the customer's tenant. The mechanism used to support this access is called Azure delegated resource management.

content.query:
managedservicesresources
| where type == "microsoft.managedservices/registrationassignments"
| where properties.provisioningState == "Succeeded"
| extend ManageeTenantName = properties.registrationDefinition.properties.manageeTenantName
| extend ManagedByTenantName = properties.registrationDefinition.properties.managedByTenantName
| extend ManagedByTenantId = properties.registrationDefinition.properties.managedByTenantId
| extend ManageeTenantId = tostring(properties.registrationDefinition.properties.manageeTenantId)
| extend PermanentAccess = properties.registrationDefinition.properties.authorizations
| extend JITAccess = properties.registrationDefinition.properties.eligibleAuthorizations
| extend AddedDate = properties.registrationDefinition.systemData.createdAt
| extend CreatedBy = systemData.createdBy
| project ManageeTenantName, ManageeTenantId, ManagedByTenantName, ManagedByTenantId, AddedDate, CreatedBy
content.title: Azure Lighthouse Delegations
content.noDataMessage: No Azure Lighthouse Delegations/Customers Detected

content.json:
# [Access Control](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/risk-management/sp800-53-controls/release-search#/controls?version=5.1&family=AC)
---
Access Control is the process of authorizing users, groups, and computers to access objects on a network, asset, and/or cloud. Key concepts that make up access control are permissions, ownership of objects, inheritance of permissions, user rights, and object auditing.

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}
]

content.query:
securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend failedResources = toint(properties.failedResources), passedResources = toint(properties.passedResources),skippedResources = toint(properties.skippedResources)
    | where failedResources + passedResources + skippedResources > 0
    | join kind = leftouter(
    securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/assessments") on subscriptionId, name
    | extend complianceState = properties.state
    | extend resourceSource = tolower(tostring(properties1.resourceDetails.Source))
    | extend recommendationId = id1
    | extend resourceId = trim(' ', tolower(tostring(case(resourceSource =~ 'azure', properties1.resourceDetails.Id,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'gcp', properties1.resourceDetails.GcpResourceId,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'aws', properties1.resourceDetails.AwsResourceId,
                                                        extract('^(.+)/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/.+$',1,recommendationId)))))
    | extend regexResourceId = extract_all(@"/providers/[^/]+(?:/([^/]+)/[^/]+(?:/[^/]+/[^/]+)?)?/([^/]+)/([^/]+)$", resourceId)[0]
    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name
    | extend RecommendationName = properties1.displayName
    | extend description = properties1.metadata.description
    | extend remediationSteps = properties1.metadata.remediationDescription
    | extend severity = properties1.metadata.severity
    | extend state = properties1.status.code
    | extend notApplicableReason = properties1.status.cause
    | extend RecommendationLink = properties1.links.azurePortal
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | extend complianceControlId = extract(@"/regulatoryComplianceControls/([^/]*)", 1, id)
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
	| where complianceControlId startswith "AC.2.*"
    | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy"),‚ÄØTotal‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state == "Healthy") by tostring(RecommendationName), ControlID = controlId, recommendationName
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Total))*100
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink) on RecommendationName  
| parse RecommendationLink with * '#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/RecommendationsBlade/assessmentKey/' assessmentKey '/' *
| distinct RecommendationName, ControlID, Total, RecommendationLink, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, assessmentKey
| sort by Total, Passed desc
content.title: [AC-2] Account Management -- Security Policy Recommendations
content.noDataMessage: Confirm Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance Initiative for NIST SP 800-53 R4 is enabled.

content.query:
SigninLogs
| where TimeGenerated > ago(90d)
| where ResultType == "0"
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by UserPrincipalName
| summarize LastSignIn = datetime_diff("day", now(), max(TimeGenerated)) by UserPrincipalName, LastSignInTime=TimeGenerated, UserId
| where LastSignIn >= 28
| project UserPrincipalName, LastSignIn, LastSignInTime, AADProfile=UserId
| sort by LastSignIn desc
| limit 250
content.title: [AC-2(3)] Account Management | Disable Accounts -- Inactive Microsoft Entra ID Accounts
content.noDataMessage: An Empty Panel Provides Opportunity To Explore Further and Implement Hardening. Controls: Confirm Licensing, Availability, and Health of Respective Offerings. Logging: Confirm Log Source is Onboarded to the Log Analytics Workspace. Time: Adjust the Time Parameter for a Larger Data-Set.

content.query:
let PreviousRoles = IdentityInfo
| where TimeGenerated > ago(7d)
| extend UserPrincipalName = AccountUPN;
IdentityInfo
| extend UserPrincipalName = AccountUPN
| join (PreviousRoles) on UserPrincipalName
| extend ChangedRoles = set_difference(AssignedRoles, AssignedRoles1)
| extend ChangedGroups = set_difference(GroupMembership, GroupMembership1)
| where ChangedRoles contains "security" or ChangedRoles contains "admin" or ChangedGroups contains "security" or ChangedGroups contains "admin"
| join (SigninLogs| extend UserProfile = strcat("https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/UserDetailsMenuBlade/Profile/userId/", UserId)|project UserPrincipalName, UserProfile, UserId) on UserPrincipalName
| project UserPrincipalName, UserProfile, ChangedRoles, ChangedGroups, ChangeObservedTime=TimeGenerated, UserId
| extend ChangedRoles=strcat(ChangedRoles)
| extend ChangedGroups=strcat(ChangedGroups)
| distinct UserPrincipalName, UserProfile, ChangedRoles, ChangedGroups, ChangeObservedTime, UserId

üí° [Network access control (NAC) integration with Intune](https://docs.microsoft.com/mem/intune/protect/network-access-control-integrate)

### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/22)
üîÄ [Azure Web Application Firewall](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/Microsoft.Network%2FFrontDoorWebApplicationFirewallPolicies)

### NIST SP 800-53 Guidance [AC-4](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/risk-management/sp800-53-controls/release-search#/control?version=5.1&number=AC-4)
### Assessment

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}
]

content.query:
securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend failedResources = toint(properties.failedResources), passedResources = toint(properties.passedResources),skippedResources = toint(properties.skippedResources)
    | where failedResources + passedResources + skippedResources > 0
    | join kind = leftouter(
    securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/assessments") on subscriptionId, name
    | extend complianceState = properties.state
    | extend resourceSource = tolower(tostring(properties1.resourceDetails.Source))
    | extend recommendationId = id1
    | extend resourceId = trim(' ', tolower(tostring(case(resourceSource =~ 'azure', properties1.resourceDetails.Id,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'gcp', properties1.resourceDetails.GcpResourceId,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'aws', properties1.resourceDetails.AwsResourceId,
                                                        extract('^(.+)/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/.+$',1,recommendationId)))))
    | extend regexResourceId = extract_all(@"/providers/[^/]+(?:/([^/]+)/[^/]+(?:/[^/]+/[^/]+)?)?/([^/]+)/([^/]+)$", resourceId)[0]
    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name
    | extend RecommendationName = properties1.displayName
    | extend description = properties1.metadata.description
    | extend remediationSteps = properties1.metadata.remediationDescription
    | extend severity = properties1.metadata.severity
    | extend state = properties1.status.code
    | extend notApplicableReason = properties1.status.cause
    | extend RecommendationLink = properties1.links.azurePortal
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | extend complianceControlId = extract(@"/regulatoryComplianceControls/([^/]*)", 1, id)
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
	| where complianceControlId startswith "AC.4"
    | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy"),‚ÄØTotal‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state == "Healthy") by tostring(RecommendationName), ControlID = controlId, recommendationName
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Total))*100
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink) on RecommendationName  
    | distinct ControlID, RecommendationName, Total, RecommendationLink, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, recommendationName
    | sort by Total desc
content.title: [AC-4] Information Flow Enforcement -- Security Policy Recommendations
content.noDataMessage: Confirm Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance Initiative for NIST SP 800-53 R4 is enabled.

content.query:
let Roles = IdentityInfo
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by UserPrincipalName=AccountUPN
| project UserPrincipalName, AssignedRoles=strcat(AssignedRoles), GroupMemberships=strcat(GroupMembership);
SigninLogs
| extend UserProfile = strcat("https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/UserDetailsMenuBlade/Profile/userId/", UserId)
| where ResultType == 0
| summarize count() by UserPrincipalName, UserProfile, UserId
| join (Roles) on UserPrincipalName
| project UserPrincipalName, UserProfile, AssignedRoles, GroupMemberships, UserId
| sort by UserPrincipalName asc
| limit 2500

# [Unsuccessful Logon Attempts (AC-7)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#unsuccessful-logon-attempts) a.‚ÄÉEnforce a limit of [Assignment: organization-defined number] consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a [Assignment: organization-defined time period]; and b.‚ÄÉAutomatically [Selection (one or more): lock the account or node for an [Assignment: organization-defined time period]; lock the account or node until released by an administrator; delay next logon prompt per [Assignment: organization-defined delay algorithm]; notify system administrator; take other [Assignment: organization-defined action]] when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [SigninLogs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/signinlogs) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Entra ID](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory/)
### Implementation üí° [Protect user accounts from attacks with Microsoft Entra ID smart lockout](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/authentication/howto-password-smart-lockout)
üí° [Manage Microsoft Entra ID smart lockout values](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/authentication/howto-password-smart-lockout#manage-azure-ad-smart-lockout-values)
### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Entra ID](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/ActiveDirectoryMenuBlade/Overview)
### NIST SP 800-53 Guidance [AC-7](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/risk-management/sp800-53-controls/release-search#/control?version=5.1&number=AC-7)
### Assessment

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}
]

content.query:
let SignInFailures = SigninLogs
| where ResultType <> 0
| extend UserProfile = strcat("https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/UserDetailsMenuBlade/Profile/userId/", UserId)
| summarize count() by UserPrincipalName, UserId, UserProfile
| extend FailedSignInCount=count_;
let LastObserved = SigninLogs
| where ResultType <> 0
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by UserPrincipalName
| project UserPrincipalName, LastFailedSignIn=TimeGenerated;
SigninLogs
| where ResultType <> 0
| make-series Trend = dcount(ResultType) default = 0 on TimeGenerated in range({TimeRange:start}, {TimeRange:end}, {TimeRange:grain}) by UserPrincipalName
| join (LastObserved) on UserPrincipalName
| join (SignInFailures) on UserPrincipalName
| project UserPrincipalName, UserProfile, FailedSignInCount, Trend, LastFailedSignIn, UserId
| sort by FailedSignInCount desc
| limit 250
content.title: [AC-7] Unsuccessful Logon Attempts -- Monitor Logon Failures

# [System Use Notification (AC-8)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#system-use-notification) a.‚ÄÉDisplay [Assignment: organization-defined system use notification message or banner] to users before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines and state that: 1.‚ÄÉUsers are accessing a U.S. Government system; 2.‚ÄÉSystem usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to audit; 3.‚ÄÉUnauthorized use of the system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties; and 4.‚ÄÉUse of the system indicates consent to monitoring and recording; b.‚ÄÉRetain the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to or further access the system; and c.‚ÄÉFor publicly accessible systems: 1.‚ÄÉDisplay system use information [Assignment: organization-defined conditions], before granting further access to the publicly accessible system; 2.‚ÄÉDisplay references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems that generally prohibit those activities; and 3.‚ÄÉInclude a description of the authorized uses of the system. üî∑ [SecurityBaselines](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securitybaseline) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/security-center/)
### Implementation üí° [Microsoft Entra ID terms of use](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/terms-of-use)
üí° [Create terms and conditions](https://docs.microsoft.com/mem/intune/enrollment/terms-and-conditions-create#create-terms-and-conditions)
üí° [Choosing the right Terms solution for your organization](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/intune-customer-success/choosing-the-right-terms-solution-for-your-organization/ba-p/280180)
üí° [Apply Azure security baselines to machines](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/defender-for-cloud/apply-security-baseline)
### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Entra ID: Conditional Access - Terms of Use](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/ConditionalAccessBlade/TermsOfUse)
üîÄ [Microsoft Endpoint Manager Admin Center: Terms & Conditions](https://endpoint.microsoft.com/#blade/Microsoft_Intune_DeviceSettings/TenantAdminMenu/termsAndConditions)
üîÄ [Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Recommendations](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/5)
### NIST SP 800-53 Guidance [AC-8](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/risk-management/sp800-53-controls/release-search#/control?version=5.1&number=AC-8)
### Assessment

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}
]

content.query:
let FailedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "banner" or Description contains "agree" or Description contains "notification" or Description contains "terms" or Description contains "privacy" or Description contains "notice"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Failed"
| summarize FailedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
let PassedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "banner" or Description contains "agree" or Description contains "notification" or Description contains "terms" or Description contains "privacy" or Description contains "notice"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Passed"
| summarize PassedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "banner" or Description contains "agree" or Description contains "notification" or Description contains "terms" or Description contains "privacy" or Description contains "notice"
| summarize
    Failed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed"),
    Passed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Passed"),
    Total‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed" or AnalyzeResult == "Passed")
    by Description
| extend PassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed / todouble(Total)) * 100
| join kind=fullouter(FailedAssets) on Description
| join kind=fullouter(PassedAssets) on Description
| project Description, Total, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, PassedAssets, FailedAssets
| sort by Total, Passed desc
| limit 250
content.title: [AC-8] System Use Notifications -- Configure Security Baselines

# [Session Termination (AC-12)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#session-termination) Automatically terminate a user session after [Assignment: organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect]. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [AADUserRiskEvents](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/aaduserriskevents) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory/)
### Implementation üí° [Conditional Access: Sign-in risk-based Conditional Access](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-policy-risk)
üí° [Conditional Access: User risk-based Conditional Access](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/howto-conditional-access-policy-risk-user)
üí° [Continuous access evaluation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/conditional-access/concept-continuous-access-evaluation)
üí° [Account lockout threshold](https://docs.microsoft.com/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/account-lockout-threshold)
üí° [Protecting your organization against password spray attacks](https://www.microsoft.com/security/blog/2020/04/23/protecting-organization-password-spray-attacks/)

content.query:
IdentityInfo
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated,*) by AccountUPN
| join kind=inner(
SigninLogs) on $left.AccountUPN==$right.UserPrincipalName
| project SigninTime=TimeGenerated1, UserPrincipalName, AppDisplayName, ResultType, AssignedRoles, Location, UserAgent, AuthenticationRequirement, Country, City, CorrelationId
| join kind=inner (
AADUserRiskEvents) on CorrelationId
| extend UserProfile = strcat("https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/UserDetailsMenuBlade/Profile/userId/", UserId), AssignedRoles=strcat(AssignedRoles)
| distinct UserPrincipalName, UserProfile,  RiskLevel, AppDisplayName, AssignedRoles, Country, SigninTime, UserId
| extend Rank=iff(RiskLevel == "high", 3, iff(RiskLevel == "medium", 2, iff(RiskLevel == "low", 1, 0)))
| sort by Rank desc
| limit 250

üî∑ [SigninLogs](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/signinlogs) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Entra ID](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/active-directory/)
üî∑ [resources](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/resource-graph/overview) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Azure Front Door](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/frontdoor/) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Azure ExpressRoute](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/expressroute/) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Azure Bastion](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/azure-bastion/) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [VPN Gateway](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/vpn-gateway/) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Azure Web Application Firewall](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/web-application-firewall/)
### Implementation üí° [What is Azure Bastion?](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/bastion/bastion-overview)

### Assessment

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}

content.query:
securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend failedResources = toint(properties.failedResources), passedResources = toint(properties.passedResources),skippedResources = toint(properties.skippedResources)
    | where failedResources + passedResources + skippedResources > 0
    | join kind = leftouter(
    securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/assessments") on subscriptionId, name
    | extend complianceState = properties.state
    | extend resourceSource = tolower(tostring(properties1.resourceDetails.Source))
    | extend recommendationId = id1
    | extend resourceId = trim(' ', tolower(tostring(case(resourceSource =~ 'azure', properties1.resourceDetails.Id,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'gcp', properties1.resourceDetails.GcpResourceId,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'aws', properties1.resourceDetails.AwsResourceId,
                                                        extract('^(.+)/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/.+$',1,recommendationId)))))
    | extend regexResourceId = extract_all(@"/providers/[^/]+(?:/([^/]+)/[^/]+(?:/[^/]+/[^/]+)?)?/([^/]+)/([^/]+)$", resourceId)[0]
    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name
    | extend RecommendationName = properties1.displayName
    | extend description = properties1.metadata.description
    | extend remediationSteps = properties1.metadata.remediationDescription
    | extend severity = properties1.metadata.severity
    | extend state = properties1.status.code
    | extend notApplicableReason = properties1.status.cause
    | extend RecommendationLink = properties1.links.azurePortal
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | extend complianceControlId = extract(@"/regulatoryComplianceControls/([^/]*)", 1, id)
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
	| where complianceControlId startswith "AC.17.*"
    | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy"),‚ÄØTotal‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state == "Healthy") by tostring(RecommendationName), ControlID = controlId, recommendationName
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Total))*100
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink) on RecommendationName  
    | distinct ControlID, RecommendationName, Total, RecommendationLink, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, recommendationName
    | sort by Total desc
content.title: [AC-17] Remote Access -- Security Policy Recommendations

# [Wireless Access (AC-18)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#wireless-access) a.‚ÄÉEstablish configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of wireless access; and b.‚ÄÉAuthorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to allowing such connections. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [SecurityBaselines](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securitybaseline) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/security-center/)
### Implementation üí° [Microsoft Endpoint Manager overview](https://docs.microsoft.com/mem/endpoint-manager-overview)

### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Endpoint Manager Admin Center](https://endpoint.microsoft.com/#home)
üîÄ [Microsoft Entra ID: Conditional Access](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/ConditionalAccessBlade/Policies)

### Assessment

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}

content.query:
let FailedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "wire"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Failed"
| summarize FailedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
let PassedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "wire"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Passed"
| summarize PassedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "wire"
| summarize
    Failed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed"),
    Passed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Passed"),
    Total‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed" or AnalyzeResult == "Passed")
    by Description
| extend PassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed / todouble(Total)) * 100
| join kind=fullouter(FailedAssets) on Description
| join kind=fullouter(PassedAssets) on Description
| project Description, Total, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, PassedAssets, FailedAssets
| sort by Total, Passed desc
| limit 250
content.title: [AC-18] Wireless Access -- Configure Security Baselines

    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
    | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy"),‚ÄØTotal‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state == "Healthy") by tostring(RecommendationName), ControlID = controlId, recommendationName
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Total))*100
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink) on RecommendationName  
    | distinct ControlID, RecommendationName, Total, RecommendationLink, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, recommendationName
   | distinct RecommendationName, Total, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, RecommendationLink
    | where RecommendationName contains "external" or RecommendationName contains "private" or RecommendationName contains "internet" or RecommendationName contains "public" or RecommendationName contains "firewall"
    | sort by Total desc
content.title: [AC-20] Use of External Information Systems -- Security Policy Recommendations

content.query:
let FailedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, RuleSetting
| where RuleSetting contains "DisableRemovableDriveScanning" or RuleSetting contains "NoDriveTypeAutoRun" or RuleSetting contains "EnableInstallerDetection"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Failed"
| summarize FailedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
let PassedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, RuleSetting
| where RuleSetting contains "DisableRemovableDriveScanning" or RuleSetting contains "NoDriveTypeAutoRun" or RuleSetting contains "EnableInstallerDetection"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Passed"
| summarize PassedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, RuleSetting
| where RuleSetting contains "DisableRemovableDriveScanning" or RuleSetting contains "NoDriveTypeAutoRun" or RuleSetting contains "EnableInstallerDetection"
| summarize
    Failed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed"),
    Passed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Passed"),
    Total‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed" or AnalyzeResult == "Passed")
    by Description
| extend PassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed / todouble(Total)) * 100
| join kind=fullouter(FailedAssets) on Description
| join kind=fullouter(PassedAssets) on Description
| project Description, Total, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, PassedAssets, FailedAssets
| sort by Total, Passed desc
| limit 250

---
Audit & Accountability involves the evaluation of configurable security and logging options to help identify gaps in security policies and mechanisms.

# [Audit Events (AU-2)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#audit-events) a.‚ÄÉIdentify the types of events that the system is capable of logging in support of the audit function: [Assignment: organization-defined event types that the system is capable of logging]; b.‚ÄÉCoordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to guide and inform the selection criteria for events to be logged; c.‚ÄÉSpecify the following event types for logging within the system: [Assignment: organization-defined event types (subset of the event types defined in AU-2a.) along with the frequency of (or situation requiring) logging for each identified event type]; d.‚ÄÉProvide a rationale for why the event types selected for logging are deemed to be adequate to support after-the-fact investigations of incidents; and e.‚ÄÉReview and update the event types selected for logging [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [AzureActivity](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/azureactivity) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Azure Monitor]( https://azure.microsoft.com/services/monitor/)
üî∑ [OfficeActivity](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/officeactivity) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Office 365]( https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/security/office-365-defender)
üî∑ [SecurityEvent](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securityevent) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Endpoint](https://www.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/security/endpoint-defender)
üî∑ [CommonSecurityLog](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/CommonSecurityLog) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Syslog/CEF Connector](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-log-forwarder?tabs=rsyslog)
üî∑ [AWSCloudTrail](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/AWSCloudTrail) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [AWS CloudTrail](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-aws?tabs=s3)

content.query:
let LastLogTime = union withsource = _TableName *
| summarize LastLog_Time = arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _TableName;
union withsource = _TableName *
| summarize last_log = datetime_diff("second",now(), max(TimeGenerated)) by _TableName
| where last_log > 0
| join kind=inner (LastLogTime) on _TableName
| project DataTable = _TableName, ['Last Log Received'] = last_log, LastLog_Time
| where DataTable !contains "SRCH"
| order by ['Last Log Received'] desc

# [Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting (AU-6)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#audit-review-analysis-and-reporting) a.‚ÄÉReview and analyze system audit records [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for indications of [Assignment: organization-defined inappropriate or unusual activity] and the potential impact of the inappropriate or unusual activity; b.‚ÄÉReport findings to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]; and c.‚ÄÉAdjust the level of audit record review, analysis, and reporting within the system when there is a change in risk based on law enforcement information, intelligence information, or other credible sources of information. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [SecurityRegulatoryCompliance](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securityregulatorycompliance) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/security-center/)
### Implementation üí° [Connect Microsoft Entra ID data to Microsoft Sentinel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-azure-active-directory)
üí° [Use Azure Monitor workbooks to visualize and monitor your data](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/monitor-your-data)
üí° [Create new workbook](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/monitor-your-data#create-new-workbook)
üí° [Microsoft Sentinel data connectors](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-data-sources)
üí° [Turn auditing on or off](https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/turn-audit-log-search-on-or-off?#turn-on-audit-log-search)
üí° [Security & Compliance Center](https://docs.microsoft.com/office365/servicedescriptions/office-365-platform-service-description/office-365-securitycompliance-center)
üí° [Audited activities](https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/search-the-audit-log-in-security-and-compliance?#audited-activities)
üí° [Use audit logs to track and monitor events in Microsoft Intune](https://docs.microsoft.com/mem/intune/fundamentals/monitor-audit-logs)
### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/22)
üîÄ [Microsoft Endpoint Manager Admin Center](https://endpoint.microsoft.com/#home)
üîÄ [Microsoft 365 Compliance Manager](https://compliance.microsoft.com/homepage)
üîÄ [Microsoft Entra ID](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_AAD_IAM/ActiveDirectoryMenuBlade/Overview)
üîÄ [Azure Monitor](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Monitoring/AzureMonitoringBrowseBlade/overview)
### NIST SP 800-53 Guidance [AU-6](https://csrc.nist.gov/Projects/risk-management/sp800-53-controls/release-search#/control?version=5.1&number=AU-6)
### Assessment

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},
    {"value": "Out of Scope", "label": "Out of Scope"}
]

content.query:
securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend failedResources = toint(properties.failedResources), passedResources = toint(properties.passedResources),skippedResources = toint(properties.skippedResources)
    | where failedResources + passedResources + skippedResources > 0
    | join kind = leftouter(
    securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/assessments") on subscriptionId, name
    | extend complianceState = properties.state
    | extend resourceSource = tolower(tostring(properties1.resourceDetails.Source))
    | extend recommendationId = id1
    | extend resourceId = trim(' ', tolower(tostring(case(resourceSource =~ 'azure', properties1.resourceDetails.Id,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'gcp', properties1.resourceDetails.GcpResourceId,
                                                        resourceSource =~ 'aws', properties1.resourceDetails.AwsResourceId,
                                                        extract('^(.+)/providers/Microsoft.Security/assessments/.+$',1,recommendationId)))))
    | extend regexResourceId = extract_all(@"/providers/[^/]+(?:/([^/]+)/[^/]+(?:/[^/]+/[^/]+)?)?/([^/]+)/([^/]+)$", resourceId)[0]
    | extend resourceType = iff(regexResourceId[1] != "", regexResourceId[1], iff(regexResourceId[0] != "", regexResourceId[0], "subscriptions"))
    | extend resourceName = regexResourceId[2]
    | extend recommendationName = name
    | extend RecommendationName = properties1.displayName
    | extend description = properties1.metadata.description
    | extend remediationSteps = properties1.metadata.remediationDescription
    | extend severity = properties1.metadata.severity
    | extend state = properties1.status.code
    | extend notApplicableReason = properties1.status.cause
    | extend RecommendationLink = properties1.links.azurePortal
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | extend complianceControlId = extract(@"/regulatoryComplianceControls/([^/]*)", 1, id)
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId == "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend  controlName = tostring(properties.description)
    | project controlId = name, controlName
    | distinct  *) on $right.controlId == $left.complianceControlId
	| where complianceControlId startswith "AU.6."
    | summarize‚ÄØFailed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy"),‚ÄØPassed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Healthy"),‚ÄØTotal‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(state‚ÄØ==‚ÄØ"Unhealthy" or state == "Healthy") by tostring(RecommendationName), ControlID = controlId, recommendationName
    |‚ÄØextend‚ÄØPassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed/todouble(Total))*100
    | join kind = leftouter (securityresources
    | where type == "microsoft.security/regulatorycompliancestandards/regulatorycompliancecontrols/regulatorycomplianceassessments"
    | extend complianceStandardId = replace( "-", " ", extract(@'/regulatoryComplianceStandards/([^/]*)', 1, id))
    | where complianceStandardId ==  "NIST SP 800 53 R4"
    | extend RecommendationName = tostring(properties.description)
    | extend RecommendationLink = tostring(properties.assessmentDetailsLink)
    | project RecommendationName, RecommendationLink) on RecommendationName  
    | distinct ControlID, RecommendationName, Total, RecommendationLink, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, recommendationName
    | sort by Total desc
content.title: [AU-6] Audit Review, Analysis, & Reporting -- Security Policy Recommendations
content.noDataMessage: Confirm Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance Initiative for NIST SP 800-53 R4 is enabled.

# [Audit Reduction and Report Generation (AU-7)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#audit-reduction-and-report-generation) Provide and implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability that: a.‚ÄÉSupports on-demand audit record review, analysis, and reporting requirements and after-the-fact investigations of incidents; and b.‚ÄÉDoes not alter the original content or time ordering of audit records. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [SecurityIncident](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securityincident) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Sentinel](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/azure-sentinel/)
### Implementation üí° [Investigate incidents with Microsoft Sentinel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/investigate-cases)
üí° [Audit logs in Microsoft Entra ID](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/reports-monitoring/concept-audit-logs)
üí° [Azure security logging and auditing](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/security/fundamentals/log-audit)
### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Sentinel](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/HubsExtension/BrowseResource/resourceType/microsoft.securityinsightsarg%2Fsentinel)

parameters.name: ImplementationStatus
parameters.label: Status
parameters.jsonData:
[
    {"value": "Not Implemented", "label": "Not Implemented", "selected":true},
    {"value": "Implemented", "label": "Implemented"},
    {"value": "Alternate Implementation", "label": "Alternate Implementation"},
    {"value": "Planned", "label": "Planned"},

content.query:
SecurityIncident
| extend Tactics = tostring(parse_json(tostring(AdditionalData.tactics)))
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by IncidentNumber
| parse IncidentUrl with * 'https://portal.azure.com/#asset/Microsoft_Azure_Security_Insights/Incident' IncidentBlade
| extend SeverityRank=iff(Severity == "High", 3, iff(Severity == "Medium", 2, iff(Severity == "Low", 1, iff(Severity == "Informational", 0, 0))))
| sort by SeverityRank, TimeGenerated desc
| project ['Incident Name']=Title, IncidentNumber, Severity, IncidentUrl, FirstActivityTime, IncidentBlade
| limit 250
content.title: [AU-7] Audit Reduction and Report Generation -- Microsoft Sentinel: Security Incidents

# [Time Stamps (AU-8)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#time-stamps) a.‚ÄÉUse internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records; and b.‚ÄÉRecord time stamps for audit records that meet [Assignment: organization-defined granularity of time measurement] and that use Coordinated Universal Time, have a fixed local time offset from Coordinated Universal Time, or that include the local time offset as part of the time stamp. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [SecurityBaselines](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securitybaseline) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/security-center/)

content.query:

| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "NTP" or Description contains "clock" or Description contains "time" or Description contains "sync"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Failed"
| summarize FailedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
let PassedAssets=SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "NTP" or Description contains "clock" or Description contains "time" or Description contains "sync"
| where AnalyzeResult == "Passed"
| summarize PassedAssets = makelist(Computer) by Description;
SecurityBaseline
| summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by _ResourceId, Description
| where Description contains "NTP" or Description contains "clock" or Description contains "time" or Description contains "sync"
| summarize
    Failed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed"),
    Passed‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Passed"),
    Total‚ÄØ=‚ÄØcountif(AnalyzeResult == "Failed" or AnalyzeResult == "Passed")
    by Description
| extend PassedControls‚ÄØ= (Passed / todouble(Total)) * 100
| join kind=fullouter(FailedAssets) on Description
| join kind=fullouter(PassedAssets) on Description
| project Description, Total, PassedControls, Passed, Failed, PassedAssets, FailedAssets
| sort by Total, Passed desc
| limit 250

content.query:
resources
| where type =~ 'microsoft.operationalinsights/workspaces' 
| extend state = trim(' ', tostring(properties.provisioningState))
		,sku   = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.name))
        ,skuUpdate = trim(' ', tostring(properties.sku.lastSkuUpdate))
		,retentionDays = trim(' ', tostring(properties.retentionInDays))
		,dailyquotaGB  = trim(' ', tostring(properties.workspaceCapping.dailyQuotaGb))
| extend dailyquotaGB = iif(dailyquotaGB !=-1.0, dailyquotaGB,"Not set")
| extend skuUpdate    = iif(strlen(skuUpdate) > 0, skuUpdate,"Unknown")
| extend sentinel     = iif(toint(retentionDays) < 90,"If you have Sentinel, you can change your retention to 90days (free)?","")
| project LogAnalyticsWorkspace=id, ['Resource Group']=resourceGroup, 	
LogRetention_Days=retentionDays

# [Audit Generation (AU-12)](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/samples/nist-sp-800-53-r4?WT.mc_id=Portal-fx#audit-record-retention) a.‚ÄÉProvide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing as defined in AU-2a on [Assignment: organization-defined system components]; b.‚ÄÉAllow [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] to select the event types that are to be logged by specific components of the system; and c.‚ÄÉGenerate audit records for the event types defined in AU-2c that include the audit record content defined in AU-3. ### Recommended Logs üî∑ [SecurityRegulatoryCompliance](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/reference/tables/securityregulatorycompliance) ‚ú≥Ô∏è [Microsoft Defender for Cloud](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/security-center/)
### Implementation üí° [Connect Microsoft Entra ID data to Microsoft Sentinel](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/connect-azure-active-directory)
üí° [Use Azure Monitor workbooks to visualize and monitor your data](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/monitor-your-data)
üí° [Create new workbook](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sentinel/monitor-your-data#create-new-workbook)

üí° [Turn auditing on or off](https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/turn-audit-log-search-on-or-off?#turn-on-audit-log-search)

üí° [Audited activities](https://docs.microsoft.com/microsoft-365/compliance/search-the-audit-log-in-security-and-compliance?#audited-activities)
üí° [Use audit logs to track and monitor events in Microsoft Intune](https://docs.microsoft.com/mem/intune/fundamentals/monitor-audit-logs)
### Microsoft Portals üîÄ [Microsoft Defender for Cloud: Regulatory Compliance](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Security/SecurityMenuBlade/22)
üîÄ [Microsoft Endpoint Manager Admin Center](https://endpoint.microsoft.com/#home)
üîÄ [Microsoft 365 Compliance Manager](https://compliance.microsoft.com/homepage)

üîÄ [Azure Monitor](https://portal.azure.com/#blade/Microsoft_Azure_Monitoring/AzureMonitoringBrowseBlade/overview)
